text: The Violin Concerto No. 1 in A major, Op. 20, by Camille Saint-Saëns is a musical composition for violin and orchestra that was made in 1859. While this concerto is named "No. 1", it was Saint-Saëns' second concerto for the violin, but was made public first. This piece of music was written for violinist Pablo Sarasate, who was only 15 years old at the time. == Instrumentation == The music was made for violin, 2 flutes/piccolo, 2 oboes, 2 clarinets, 2 bassoons, 2 horns, 2 trumpets, timpani, and strings. == Structure == The music has one part, labeled allegro. The music is played for 12 minutes. == References == == Other websites == * Violin Concerto No. 1: Scores at the International Music Score Library Project Saint-Saens 01 Category:Compositions by Camille Saint- Saëns Category:Compositions in A major
title: Violin Concerto No. 1 (Saint-Saëns)
